title: Ticket #545: Windows Hawkeye script to publish free memory
description: Folks would like to know how much free memory their windows machines have. A hawkeye script ought to be able to to this.
remarks:
2009-Jun-05 13:42:56 by tannenba:
The startd already initializes and depends upon the windows registry performance counter DLL, in order to get CPU utilization into to compute load average.

It should be relatively easy to add a knob which asks the startd on Windows to also publish additional performance counter values into the machine ad. No need for a hawkeye plugin, this could be "built in" (since it already is).

Thoughts?

2009-Jun-16 16:35:02 by burnett:
How far do we want to take this? It would be tryvial to get the available memory, but would it be an idea to allow users to select all the values they'd like put into the machine ad? For instance, users may be interesting in VMware's statistics, or the number or process running on the machine, etc. Just an idea.
